2523.text:
Several years ago, I

2527.text:
and how he overcame
several failures

2530.text:
but never lost his passion
for changing the world.

2534.text:
In his 2005 Commencement
speech given here at Stanford,

2538.text:
Steve said, "When I
was 17, I read a quote

2543.text:
that went something like,
if you live each day

2547.text:
as if it was your last, someday
you'll most certainly be right."

2556.text:
He continued, "Since
then, I have looked

2560.text:
in the mirror every
morning and asked myself,

2563.text:
'If today were the last day
of my life, would I want

2568.text:
to do what I am about
to do today?'

2570.text:
And whenever the answer has been
'No' for too many days in a row,

2577.text:
I know I need to
change something."

2581.text:
Steve was determined to live a
life he felt passionate about.

2587.text:
Facing a cancer diagnosis simply
reinforced his determination.

2593.text:
As he told our graduates,
"Your time is limited,

2599.text:
so don't waste it living
someone else's life.

2604.text:
Have the courage to follow
your heart and your intuition."
